member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.DataLakeStoreFrontEndAdapter
member.summary: A front end adapter that communicates with the DataLake Store. This is a syncrhonous call adapter, which has certain efficiency limitations. In the future, new adapters that are created should consider implementing the methods asynchronously.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.SingleSegmentDownloader
member.summary: Represents a downloader for a single segment of a larger file.
Creates a new downloader for a single segment.
member.param: The sequence number of the segment.
The metadata for the entire download.
A pointer to the front end.
(Optional) A tracker to report progress on this segment.

member.summary: Creates a new downloader for a single segment.
member.param: The sequence number of the segment.
The metadata for the entire download.
A pointer to the front end.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.SingleSegmentDownloader.UseBackOffRetryStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use a back-off (exponenential) in case of individual block failures. If set to 'false' every retry is handled immediately; otherwise an amount of time is waited between retries, as a function of power of 2.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.SingleSegmentDownloader.Download
member.summary: Downloads the portion of the InputFilePath to the given TargetStreamPath, starting at the given StartOffset. The segment is further divided into equally-sized blocks which are downloaded in sequence. Each such block is attempted a certain number of times; if after that it still cannot be downloaded, the entire segment is aborted (in which case no cleanup is performed on the server).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.SingleSegmentDownloader.VerifyDownloadedStream
member.summary: Verifies the downloaded stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.SingleSegmentDownloader.DownloadSegmentContents
member.summary: Downloads the segment contents.

member.summary: Waits for retry.

member.summary: Reports the progress.

if set to true [is failed].

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.StringExtensions.FindNewline(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding,System.String)
member.summary: Finds the index in the given buffer of a newline character, either the first or the last (based on the parameters). If a combined newline (\r\n), the index returned is that of the last character in the sequence.
member.param: The buffer to search in.
The index of the first byte to start searching at.
The number of bytes to search, starting from the given startOffset.
If true, searches from the startOffset down to the beginning of the buffer. If false, searches upwards.
member.returns: The index of the closest newline character in the sequence (based on direction) that was found. Returns -1 if not found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadMetadata.AlignSegmentsToRecordBoundaries
member.summary: Aligns segments to match record boundaries (where a record boundary = a new line). If not possible (max record size = 4MB), throws an exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadMetadata.DetermineLengthAdjustment(Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata,System.IO.FileStream,System.Text.Encoding,System.String)
member.summary: Calculates the value by which we'd need to adjust the length of the given segment, by searching for the nearest newline around it (before and after), and returning the distance to it (which can be positive, if after, or negative, if before).
member.exception: If no record boundary could be located on either side of the segment end offset within the allowed distance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadMetadata.FindClosestToCenter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value (of the given two) that is closest in absolute terms to the center value. Values that are negative are ignored (since these are assumed to represent array indices).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadMetadata.ReadIntoBufferAroundReference(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int64)
member.summary: Reads data from the given file into the given buffer, centered around the given file offset. The first half of the buffer will be filled with data right before the given offset, while the remainder of the buffer will contain data right after it (of course, containing the byte at the given offset).
member.returns: The number of bytes reads, which could be less than the length of the input buffer if we can't read due to the beginning or the end of the file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadParameters
member.summary: Represents parameters for the DataLake Uploader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadParameters.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new set of parameters for the DataLake Uploader.
member.param: The full path to the file or folder to be uploaded.
The full stream path where the file or folder will be uploaded to.
Name of the account to upload to.
The per file thread count, indicating the number of file segments to upload in parallel. This number is capped at FILE_SIZE/maxSegmentLength for optimal performance.
The parallel file count, indicating the number of files to upload in parallel during a folder upload. This parameter is ignored for single file uploads. Default is 5 for folder uploads
(Optional) Whether to overwrite the target stream or not.
(Optional) Indicates whether to resume a previously interrupted upload.
(Optional) Indicates whether to treat the input file as a binary file (true), or whether to align upload blocks to record boundaries (false).
(Optional) Indicates whether to upload the source folder recursively or not. If true, will upload the source directory and all sub directories, preserving directory structure.
(Optional) if set to true [is download] instead of an upload scenario. Default is false.
Maximum length of each segment. The default is 256mb, which gives optimal performance. Modify at your own risk.

(Optional) Indicates the directory path where to store the local upload metadata file while the upload is in progress. This location must be writeable from this application. Default location: SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadParameters.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new set of parameters for the DataLake Uploader.
member.param: The full path to the file or folder to be uploaded.
The full stream path where the file or folder will be uploaded to.
Name of the account to upload to.
if set to true [use segment block back off retry strategy].
The per file thread count, indicating the number of file segments to upload in parallel. This number is capped at FILE_SIZE/maxSegmentLength for optimal performance.
The parallel file count, indicating the number of files to upload in parallel during a folder upload. This parameter is ignored for single file uploads. Default is 5 for folder uploads
(Optional) Whether to overwrite the target stream or not.
(Optional) Indicates whether to resume a previously interrupted upload.
(Optional) Indicates whether to treat the input file as a binary file (true), or whether to align upload blocks to record boundaries (false).
(Optional) Indicates whether to upload the source folder recursively or not. If true, will upload the source directory and all sub directories, preserving directory structure.
(Optional) if set to true [is download] instead of an upload scenario. Default is false.
Maximum length of the segment.

(Optional) Indicates the directory path where to store the local upload metadata file while the upload is in progress. This location must be writeable from this application. Default location: SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.CalculateSegmentLength(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the length of a typical (non-terminal) segment for a file of the given length that is split into the given number of segments.
member.param: The length of the file, in bytes.
The number of segments to split the file into.
member.exception: Number of segments must be a positive integer

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.CalculateSegmentLength(System.Int32,Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadMetadata)
member.summary: Calculates the length of the segment with given number for a file with given length that is split into the given number of segments.
member.param: The segment number.
The metadata for the current upload.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.SegmentCountReducer
member.summary: The Reducer is the number of times the length of the file should increase in order to inflate the number of segments by a factor of 'Multiplier'. See class description for more details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.SegmentCountMultiplier
member.summary: The Multiplier is the number of times the segment count is inflated when the length of the file increases by a factor of 'Reducer'. See class description for more details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.MinimumSegmentSize
member.summary: The minimum number of bytes in a segment. For best performance, should be sync-ed with the upload buffer length.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.CalculateSegmentCount(System.Int64)
member.summary: Calculates the number of segments a file of the given length should be split into. The method to calculate this is based on some empirical measurements that allows both the number of segments and the length of each segment to grow as the input file size grows. They both grow on a logarithmic pattern as the file length increases. The formula is roughly this: * Multiplier = Min(100, 50 * 2 ^ Log10(FileLengthInGB)) * SegmentCount = Max(1, Multiplier * 2 ^ Log10(FileLengthInGB) Essentially we quadruple the number of segments for each tenfold increase in the file length, with certain caps. The formula is designed to support both small files and extremely large files (and not cause very small segment lengths or very large number of segments).
member.param: The length of the file, in bytes.
member.returns: The number of segments to split the file into. Returns 0 if fileLength is 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.SegmentNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the number (sequence) of the segment in the file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the starting offset of the segment in the file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the size of the segment (in bytes).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the current upload status for this segment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataLake.StoreUploader.UploadSegmentMetadata.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stream path assigned to this segment.
